column4: im trying to compile a program for the first time since i cant find it anywhere in a synaptic compatible package and i really need it, i got my terminal to say "myaccountname@computername: ~/Desktop/ProgramName-0.1$" but the "less install" or "./configure" commands wont work, what am i doing wrong?
i thought sudo apt-get was only for programs listed in synaptic or add & remove prorams?
bash:  ./configure:  No such file or directory
there are deb available here.. http://moblock-deb.sourceforge.net/
you've got 3 lines for the res you want.  I would comment out 2 of the three and restart gdm.  If that doesn't work switch to the next one.. then the next.
sorry .. were you wanting someone to look at your xorg in pastebin or did I get the nick wrong?
did you see my post for the deb for that program? You can find it here..http://moblock-deb.sourceforge.net/
is there a reason to compile it instead of installing the deb?
I hope it works for you.. I used the Linux portion of google to find it by going to www.google.com/linux... very helpful
where do i add the sources for moblock in my sources.list file?
hang on I'll look on my machine.
